meanings.definition: Promoting or facilitating drying or hardening.
meanings.sent1: The siccative weather quickly dried the wet clothes on the line.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a siccative varnish to speed up the drying time of the paint.
meanings.sent3: The siccative sun turned the once muddy path into a dry and dusty trail.
meanings.sent4: Her siccative instructions helped the students finish the project faster.
meanings.sent5: The siccative wind hardened the clay sculpture in no time.

meanings.definition: A substance added to paint to speed up drying.
meanings.sent1: The painter mixed a siccative into the oil paint to make it dry faster.
meanings.sent2: The siccative in the paint allowed the artist to work on multiple layers in a day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student added too much siccative to the paint, causing it to dry too quickly.
meanings.sent4: The siccative in the paint acted like a magical timekeeper, making the colors set in record time.
meanings.sent5: The siccative smelled strong but was essential for the paint to dry rapidly.
